Key Match Events: Denmark thought they had taken the lead just after 20 minutes when Jonas Wind knocked a corner into the net, but it was flagged by VAR as the ball had gone out of play before even finding Wind, while the Denmark star was also in a grapple with the Serbia goalkeeper.
Serbia thought they had taken the lead when they found the net in the second-half through a Joachim Andersen own goal, but it too was disallowed.
Jannik Vestergaard got a lot of power behind a header as he met a corner but it was straight at the goalkeeper.
Aleksandar Mitrovic pounced on the ball and lashed it towards goal but missed the target in the 81st minute.
Post-Match Reflections: Denmark ensured they progress to the knockout round of Euro 2024 after a nervy 0-0 draw against Serbia on Tuesday.

Serbia head home with two points from their three matches in the tournament. Incredibly, they only clinched second spot over Slovenia due to their superior performance in qualification, with the two teams registering identical records in the tournament.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Predrag Rajkovic pulled off three saves to keep his team in the game and, up until the final minute, in with a chance of going through to the next round.
Aleksandar Mitrovic had more attempts on goal than anyone else and failed to hit the target with any of them.
